intro: Licania discolor, commonly known as the purple-leafed licania, is a tropical plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is native to Central and South America, where it thrives in humid, shaded environments. The plant is characterized by its striking purple foliage, which contrasts with its green stems and pale flowers. Licania discolor has small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink, and it produces capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in tropical gardens and greenhouses.
